title: CKCComboBox: Removed dummy wheelEvent() override.
message:
CKCComboBox: Removed dummy wheelEvent() override.

This code seems to have been disabled already in 2007 and possibly earlier (see
commit 45c9cc344b54576c0f95b05149f18ac51955f9bb). Since this triggers static
analysis tools, let's just remove it. I think removing it should have identical
semantics to the current behaviour, and I don't remember anybody complaining
about this.

title: CBookmarkIndex: Fixed flawed drag enter logic.
message:
CBookmarkIndex: Fixed flawed drag enter logic.

In general there seemed to have been two serious flaws:
  * Calling setState(QAbstractItemView::DraggingState) before
    QTreeView::dragEnterEvent(event) messed up the internal state of QTreeView,
    which allowed arbitrary entering drags to cause (possibly among other
    things) startDrag() being called by the next QTreeView::mouseMoveEvent()
    call, causing a new invalid drag to leave (sometimes with the mouse button
    depressed).
  * Attempting to handle the event AFTER it had already been handled by
    QTreeView::dragEnterEvent(), especially for the case of internal drag events
    where event->source() == this.

title: Revert "Visual Studio 2013 does not support all c++11 features."
message:
Revert "Visual Studio 2013 does not support all c++11 features."

This reverts commit be653444a89e6362fc62d9bc1812b9b3f6f9ac5c.

If one compiler doesn't support the features, these SHOULD NOT be
unconditionally disabled for ALL compilers! If there's a real need to support
MSVC 2013 (current latest seems to be MSVC 2015 Update 1) such changes should
be conditional depending on some macro being enabled.

PS: be653444 also instroduced a number of trailing whitespace issues.

title: frontend, BibleTime: Work around moc failure in Release mode.
message:
frontend, BibleTime: Work around moc failure in Release mode.

The moc_bibletime.cpp file generated in release mode still referred to the
slotDebugWindowClosing, slotDebugTimeout and slotShowDebugWindow methods.
This caused compilation of moc_bibletime.cpp to fail because these methods
are not declared when NDEBUG is set.

The actual reason for this is that moc is not given the same -DNDEBUG define.
I'm currently too lazy to fix this properly in our CMake files, since using
C++11-style connect/disconnect is something we need to switch to in the future
anyway.

Thanks to Martin Gruner for reporting this issue.

title: util: Added some helper macros.
message:
util: Added some helper macros.

In some detail,
  * BT_CONNECT* macros help to assert return status of QObject::connect().
  * BT_SCOPE_EXIT will run code when leaving the current scope.
  * BT_STRING_JOIN will help join strings during preprocessing.
  * BT_WRAP helps wrap arguments passed through multiple levels of macros.

the stop signal itself.

title: Converted all SVG icons to "plain" SVG.
message:
Converted all SVG icons to "plain" SVG.

Actually these can be optimized further, but this round was done using only
Inkscape:

  for i in *.svg; do
      mv "$i" "$i.orig"
      inkscape --without-gui --export-plain-svg="$i" "$i.orig"
      rm "$i.orig"
  done

title: Refactored BtInstallThread and the install progress dialog.
message:
Refactored BtInstallThread and the install progress dialog.

This was in part done to fix a bug which caused BibleTime to freeze if the
installation of a module failed. This was caused by an unhandled case in
BtInstallThread which resulted in BtInstallProgressDialog not being notified
of failure.

While working out this bug, numerous other bugs were found and I refactored the
classes a bit. Now a single BtInstallThread thread handles installation of all
modules. I also removed buttons to stop installation of single modules from the
progress dialog. This made the design much more simple, and since installation
was not done in parallel anyway, these buttons had ambigious semantics.

title: backend: Optimized deleting orphaned of indexes and probably fixed a crash.
message:
backend: Optimized deleting orphaned of indexes and probably fixed a crash.

This code may crash because we were using operator[], directly on QDir, for
which to the documentation does not guarantee an entry will exist after the
previous call to count(), possible leading to and invalid index assertion.
Instead we now first create a constant copy of the entry list, and iterate on
the copy instead.

title: Renamed a class to work around a weird build issue on some systems.
message:
Renamed a class to work around a weird build issue on some systems.

This is probably caused by building Sword and BibleTime in the same directory
where the osismorphsegmentation.cpp.o file overwrites the one from Sword.

I mean who on earth has such kind of build system set up?! This seems just plain
stupid, but I'm working around this to make it easier for them to get it built
and perhaps get some good binaries.

title: CDisplayTemplateMgr: Fall back to default template instead of asserting.
message:
CDisplayTemplateMgr: Fall back to default template instead of asserting.

One of the asserts in the beginning CDisplayTemplateMgr::fillTemplate() fails
if the template is not found. This happens on startup and may prevent the user
from starting BibleTime.

title: Bump CMake requirement from 2.6.2 to 2.8.9.
message:
Bump CMake requirement from 2.6.2 to 2.8.9.

CMake 2.6.2 has not worked for a long time anyway. Nobody complained. Anyway
version 2.8 is required for a lot of CMake language features to work, 2.8.2 is
required for FindGit.cmake and 2.8.9 is required for Qt 5 compatibility, which
is why we bump to 2.8.9.

title: Removed FindGit.cmake.
message:
Removed FindGit.cmake.

Reasons:
* Newer versions of CMake already have a FindGit module.
* The git-svn logic is no longer needed.
* Using "git rev-parse" instead of "git rev-list" is better anyway.
* One less module to maintain and give others credit for.

title: Fixed extra *.tmpl files not being considered as template candidates.
message:
Fixed extra *.tmpl files not being considered as template candidates.

Now all *.css and *.tmpl files in the display-templates/ folder are
considered as display templates with the exception of "Basic.tmpl",
which is currently the base for all *.css templates. This finally
provides the ability for templates to provide extra functionality
via javascript inclusion etc.

This was a port from stable-2.9.

This is because setQActionCheckedNoTrigger() doesn't need to be a
class method. If it were a class method it should have been static.
However, since it might also find its use elsewhere in code it is
better it were a global function on its own.

title: Provided a CMake variable BIBLETIME_FRONTEND to select the frontend to build.
message:
Provided a CMake variable BIBLETIME_FRONTEND to select the frontend to build.

To add a new frontend, the bibletime_FRONTEND_${BIBLETIME_FRONTEND}_SOURCES
and bibletime_FRONTEND_${BIBLETIME_FRONTEND}_MOCABLE_HEADERS variables must be
set in cmake/BTSourceFileList.cmake, and a new frontend string must be added
to bibletime_AVAILABLE_FRONTENDS in the same file.

Note that currently this does not affect translations, which are still
generated from all the sources. Support for translations must be added later.
This can and must be done without adding new translation files for each
frontend.

title: Implemented automatic detection of translations for cmake. Note that after
message:
Implemented automatic detection of translations for cmake. Note that after
adding/removing translations you must run cmake for the changes to work for
your local build.

title: Optimized splash screen handling.
message:
Optimized splash screen handling.

  * Eliminated "bool showSplash"
  * Don't limit the scope of the splash screen to the constructor, but instead
    use splash->finish(this) and splash->setAttribute(Qt::WA_DeleteOnClose); to
    make the splash screen destroy itself once the main window is shown later.
  * Call qApp->processEvents(); after each splash->showMessage() as suggested
    by Qt documentation.

title: Changed "-O0 -g" to "-O2 -ggdb" in for non-MSVC compilers in debug mode.
message:
Changed "-O0 -g" to "-O2 -ggdb" in for non-MSVC compilers in debug mode.

Since in the release mode we already use -O2, we should also use it in debug
mode to catch any errors before we release. The -ggdb flag was chosen over -g
because it (according to "man gcc") produces the best available debugging
symbols for use with GDB.

title: Removed unit tests.
message:
Removed unit tests.

Removed the unit tests for the following reasons:
1) Probably nobody runs those few tests anyway.
2) The unit tests should not be included in the main binary!
3) The way the unit tests were integrated to the build system and main.cpp was
   not very good. The complexity of the integration definately outweighs the
   usefulness of the tests.

exited before the directory cache was initialized (e.g when the command-line
--help switch was used).

title: A lot of refactoring, that could (mostly) not be done in separate commits.
message:
A lot of refactoring, that could (mostly) not be done in separate commits.
Sorry for the huge commit. I'm not very happy about the size of this commit
either.

1) Refactored CSwordBackend::FilterOptions and CSwordBackend::DisplayOptions
   into a separate btglobal.h file and refactored some of CSwordBackend.
2) While doing so, I tried to optimize constness of one method, and ended up
   changing a gazillion files and some refactoring parts of
   * CSwordBibleModuleInfo
   * CSwordKey
   * CSwordModuleInfo and CSwordModuleSearch
     * Now CSwordModuleSearch holds the search results, not CSwordModuleInfo.
   Also did other minor code changes, like simple optimizations and pass-by-copy
   eliminations.

Among these changes I worked around numerous constness issues in the Sword
library, these are now documented with \warning.

I hope I didn't break anything, but...

message:

debug mode, there will be a new item in the help menu, which will activate a
dialog showing the class inheritance of the widget under the mouse cursor, and
the class inheritance of its parents. This might help developers to identify the
widgets shown.

title: Made BtBookshelfWidget a lot more modular. By default these widgets, besides
message:
Made BtBookshelfWidget a lot more modular. By default these widgets, besides
the one on the dock, get their initial grouping order from the dock widget
every time they are created. They do not save their own grouping to the
configuration files, and it will not be restored in any other way.

title: Added a preliminary implementation of a quite universal bookshelf widget, which
message:
Added a preliminary implementation of a quite universal bookshelf widget, which
is pretty much what the contents of the bookshelf dock widget are like. This
widget is now used in the bookshelf dock, the search dialog module chooser
dialog, the bookshelf manager remove page and the module installation
confirmation dialog. All of those now include a way to text filter box, and a
button to change the grouping of the items.

title: Bug-a-thon
message:
Bug-a-thon
Reformat entire codebase with astyle. Coding conventions will soon be documented in the wiki, and can be changed, should a majority vote for different style options.
We will definitely reformat the codebase with a tool periodically from time to time now, to ensure consistency in the formatting.

title: Implemented new bookshelf models and replaced the main window bookshelf view.
message:
Implemented new bookshelf models and replaced the main window bookshelf view.
NB! Bookshelf view also has some changed functionality (details below).

My sincere hope is that the new bookshelf models implemented will help us clean
up large parts of the code in the near future, as they are not as cryptic as
messing around with QTreeWidgetItems. This will lead to much simpler code which
is more managable, and will let us easily implement cooler widgets using less
lines of code, as can be seen in the new bookshelf dock widget introduced in
this commit ("Code less. Create more."). :)

The idea is that the base model, BtBookshelfModel, which is based on
QAbstractListModel, will server as a base model for all other bookshelf models.
All BtBookshelfModel does nothing but provide an abstraction for a QList of
pointers to CSwordModuleInfo.

    m_bookshelfModel = new BtBookshelfModel(this);
    m_bookshelfModel->addModules(CPointers::backend()->moduleList());

The BtBookshelfTreeModel gets its data from a BtBookshelfModel. It provides an
hierarchical model for sword modules and can be used in various types of tree
views, such as BtBookshelfView. In addition, it is able to provide checking
(e.g. checkboxes in views) for all tree items. In the near future the module
checking support will be migrated to BtBookshelfModel.

    m_bookshelfTreeModel = new BtBookshelfTreeModel(this);
    // By default, check all modules:
    m_bookshelfTreeModel->setDefaultChecked(true);
    m_bookshelfTreeModel->setSourceModel(m_bookshelfModel);

By subclassing QSortFilterProxyModel, one can easily perform sorting and
filtering on models such as BtBookshelfModel or BtBookshelfTreeModel. As such,
the BtSelectedModulesBookshelfProxyModel may be used to filter out checked or
unchecked items in BtBookshelfTreeModel.

    m_filterProxyModel = new BtSelectedModulesBookshelfProxyModel(this);
    m_filterProxyModel->setSourceModel(m_bookshelfTreeModel);

A custom QTreeView subclass, BtBookshelfView, was implemented for displaying
module data in a BtBookshelfTreeModel model. It provides Qt signals for use
with popup menus etc.

    m_view = new BtBookshelfView(this);
    m_view->setModel(m_filterProxyModel);

I also changed the bookshelf view in the main window, by implementing a custom
dock widget, BtBookshelfDockWidget. Functionality-wise, the popup menus are a
bit smarter, depending whether you right-click a group or a module itself.
Since the popup menu items for changing the grouping and hiding modules are not
visible when right-clicking modules (which might be a problem, if there's
nowhere else to click) I added 2 toolbuttons for that. Showing and hiding
modules is done in-place, using checkboxes. Currently I also dropped support
for single-clicking items, because single clicking doesn't work well with the
in-place module hiding. BtBookshelfDockWidget also provides a number of quite
straightforward Qt signals for notifying the listener when opening, editing
etc operations on some module were requested by the user.

title: Rewrote CScrollButton, because of a bug that made the cursor vanish in the
message:
Rewrote CScrollButton, because of a bug that made the cursor vanish in the
whole application even after releasing the mouse button. This bug was caused by
the released() signal not always being emitted. Instead the widget now grabs
the mouse. I also improved the documentation and optimized the code.

message:
Added a Doxyfile for generating source code documentation.

This allows doxygen to be run in the trunk root. The documentation will be
generated into the docs/doxygen folder. Currently only HTML documentation is
generated (docs/doxygen/html/index.html). Call graph generation requires the
dot tool from GraphViz.

title: class CBTConfig -> namespace CBTConfig. Minor optimizations, cleanups etc. Noâ€¦
message:
class CBTConfig -> namespace CBTConfig. Minor optimizations, cleanups etc. No functionality changes.

The members that were private, are now inside an anonymous namespace in the
source file. Apologies for the spaces and formatting, but tab characters messed
up "svn diff" output. It took me about 2 hours to review the diff before
commiting to SVN.

Some more remarks:
* I'm puzzled why BibleTime uses such a sophisticated configuration framework.
  Personally, I think that QSettings should be enough.
* I also optimized some QMap handling, in at least 2 places in code, probably
  making it those operations twice as fast.

title: If built with MacPorts' version of ICU (4.0), it is necessary to
message:
If built with MacPorts' version of ICU (4.0), it is necessary to
include the ICU libraries in the executable bundle.  If built with
the headers provided by Fink for the built-in system library, these
files wouldn't be necessary.  Since ICU is a recent addition to OS X
and the system ICU version is old (3.2 or 3.6 dependeing on system)
I choose to build against the MacPorts version.  Just back out this change
if you want to use the system version and not include it into the
bundle.

message:

Troy will also send a subsequent patch to help with our filter problems.

title: Added new class BTModuleTreeItem.
message:
Added new class BTModuleTreeItem.

It can be used to build module tree views easily. The code was spread and repeated in at least three places in the frontend where it does not belong. Additionally it's now possible to group modules differently and filter them easily.

ATM Search dialog module chooser uses the new class but is not quite complete.

message:

when the parent is destroyed. We want to delete these immediately when closing.
